intro: Spyridium microcephalum, commonly known as the small-headed spyridium, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Rhamnaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in heathlands and open woodlands. Its flowers are usually pale yellow or greenish-yellow, and it produces small, smooth seeds. It is a perennial shrub that is well adapted to the arid and semi-arid environments of southern Australia.
